SilkTest falls in the system and integration test tool category - 
this is black box testing tool. You have the system up and running 
and you use their recording option to run through your use cases. 
Then using their scripting language [4Test], you modify your test 
cases etc to make test suites for regression runs.

JUnit on the other hand is based on the xUnit framework by Erich Beck 
and Kent Gamma and falls into the unit testing tool category. It is 
more dependent on the actual implementation and ties closely into the 
development cycle.

So, basically, you cannot compare apples and oranges. It is possible 
to use both tools on the same project.

On a personal note, I think rather highly of SilkTest's features but 
I wouldnt invest in it at the moment. There are rumours about how 
Segue software isnt doing very well recently. Their main competitor 
Mercury has a comparable tool (WinRunner) which my team uses.

Hope this helps...
-Suresh

knowledge

JUnit?

with a
